verses.text: 治好痲風病人耶穌下了山，許多人跟隨著他。

words.note: Lit. 'leprosy sick person'.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Indicates continuous action or state.

verses.text: 有一個患痲風的人前來向他跪拜，說：「主啊！如果你肯，必能使我潔淨。」

words.definition: to suffer from, to contract (a disease)

words.note: Commonly used for God/Jesus in Christian contexts.
Often refers to ritual or spiritual purity in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 耶穌伸手摸他，說：「我肯，你潔淨了吧！」他的痲風立刻潔淨了。

words.note: Often refers to ritual or spiritual purity in biblical contexts.
Indicates a new situation or accomplished change.
Indicates a suggestion, command, or affirmation.
Often refers to ritual or spiritual purity in biblical contexts.
Indicates completed action or change of state.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「你千萬不可告訴別人，只要去給祭司檢查，並且照著摩西所規定的獻上供物，好向大家作證。」

words.note: Used to emphasize a warning or instruction.

words.definition: as long as, only need to

words.note: Turns a verb into a nominal phrase, meaning 'that which is...'

verses.text: 治好百夫長的僕人耶穌到了迦百農，有一個百夫長前來懇求他，

words.note: Lit. 'hundred-man leader'; a Roman military officer.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Lit. 'hundred-man leader'; a Roman military officer.

verses.text: 說：「主啊！我的僕人癱瘓了，躺在家裡非常痛苦。」

words.note: Refers to God or a respected master.
Often used in biblical contexts for 'servant' or 'bondservant'.
Indicates a change of state or completion.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「我去醫治他。」

words.note: Often used in a spiritual or miraculous healing context.

verses.text: 百夫長回答：「主啊，要你到舍下來，實在不敢當。只要你說一句話，我的僕人就必好了。

words.note: A Roman army officer commanding 100 men.
Humble way of referring to one's own home, showing respect to the guest.
A polite expression of humility, meaning 'I'm not worthy'.
好 (good/well) + 了 (aspect particle for completion/change of state).

verses.text: 我自己是在別人的權下，也有兵在我以下；我對這個說『去！』他就去，對另一個說『來！』他就來；對僕人說『作這個！』他就作。」

words.note: Refers to being under someone's power or jurisdiction.

verses.text: 耶穌聽了，就很驚奇，對跟隨的人說：「我實在告訴你們，這樣的信心，我在以色列中從來沒有見過。

words.note: Indicates completion or a new situation.
Here, refers to following Jesus as a disciple.
In religious context, refers to spiritual faith.
Indicates within a group or place.
Always used with 不 (bù) or 沒(méi) to mean 'never'.
見 (to see) + 過 (experiential aspect particle).

verses.text: 我告訴你們，必有許多人從東從西來到，和亞伯拉罕、以撒、雅各在天國裡一起吃飯。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly kingdom'.

verses.text: 但本來要承受天國的人，反被丟在外面黑暗裡，在那裡必要哀哭切齒。」
於是耶穌對百夫長說：「回去吧！事情必照你所信的給你成就。」他的僕人就在那時痊愈了。

words.note: A Roman army officer commanding 100 men.

words.definition: (particle marking a verb as the object)
words.note: Forms a noun phrase from verb, e.g., 'what is believed'.

verses.text: 治病趕鬼耶穌來到彼得家裡，看見他的岳母發燒，病在床上。
耶穌一摸她的手，熱就退了；她就起來服事耶穌。

words.note: Used in '一...就...' structure for 'as soon as...then...'.
Commonly used in religious contexts for 'serve (God/people)'.

verses.text: 到了黃昏，有些人帶了許多被鬼附的人來見耶穌，他只用一句話就把污靈趕出去，並且醫好了所有患病的人。

words.note: Refers to being possessed by evil spirits.

verses.text: 這樣正應驗了以賽亞先知所說的：「他親自除去我們的軟弱，擔當我們的疾病。」

words.note: Often used for prophecy fulfillment.
In a biblical context, often refers to spiritual or physical frailty.

verses.text: 跟從耶穌的要求耶穌看見許多人圍著他，就吩咐往對岸去。
有一位經學家前來對他說：「老師，你無論往哪裡去，我都要跟從你！」

words.note: A person who studied and interpreted Jewish law.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「狐狸有洞，天空的飛鳥有窩，但人子卻沒有棲身（「棲身」原文作「枕頭」）的地方。」

words.note: A messianic title for Jesus, emphasizing his humanity and divine role.
Often used for finding shelter or settling down.

verses.text: 另一個門徒對他說：「主啊！請准我先回去安葬我的父親吧。」

words.note: Lit. 'door follower' or 'student at the gate'.
Used to address God or Jesus.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「跟從我吧！讓死人去埋葬他們的死人。」
平靜風浪耶穌上了船，門徒跟著他。
忽然海上起了狂風，甚至船都被波濤掩蓋，但耶穌卻睡著了。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix.

verses.text: 他們走來把他叫醒，說：「主啊！救命啊！我們沒命了！」

words.note: Used to address God or Jesus.
Commonly used as an urgent cry for help.
Lit. 'have no life'.

verses.text: 耶穌卻對他們說：「小信的人哪！為甚麼害怕呢？」他就起來斥責風和海，風浪就平靜了。

words.note: Refers to having weak or insufficient faith.

verses.text: 眾人都驚奇，說：「這是甚麼人，連風和海也聽從他？」
治好鬼附的人耶穌過到對岸加大拉人的地區，遇見兩個被鬼附著的人從墓地出來；他們十分兇暴，甚至沒有人敢從那條路經過。

words.note: Specifically refers to being possessed by evil spirits.
People from Gadara, a city in the Decapolis.

verses.text: 他們喊叫：「 神的兒子，我們跟你有甚麼關係呢？時候還沒有到，你就來這裡叫我們受苦嗎？」

words.note: Capitalized in Christian contexts.

verses.text: 那時遠遠有一大群豬正在吃東西。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes distance.
東西 (dōngxi) literally means 'east-west' but colloquially 'things/stuff', often implying food when paired with 'eat'.

verses.text: 那些鬼就求耶穌，說：「如果要趕我們出來，就准我們進到豬群裡去吧。」

words.note: Refers to evil spirits in a biblical context.
Indicates suggestion, request, or mild command.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「出去吧！」他們就出來，進了豬群。那一群豬忽然闖下山崖，掉在海裡淹死了。

words.note: Indicates suggestion, request, or mild command.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 放豬的人逃進城裡，把被鬼附的人的遭遇和一切事情，都報告出來。

words.note: Introduces the object of a disposal verb.

verses.text: 全城的居民都出來要見耶穌，看見了他，就求他離開他們的地區。
